title: Major Ganpat Rai's Advice to Students
text: New India invites attention to the advice given by Major Ganapt Rai, I.M.S., District Medical and Sanitary Officer, Madura, to the students. Presiding at the prize-giving ceremony of the American College on the 24th September he is reported to have drawn the attention of the audience to a "painful point," "which was," he said, "that Indians had been trained somehow or other to develop a great deal of the sense of dependence. They depended for their education on the Americans, and for industrial purposes on the Germans and Austrians. He said that unless the sense of independence was revived in them to maintain schools and establish industries there would not be any progress.
